results.title: Social Media Manager
results.description:
ABOUT HAPPITY:

Happity is a family friendly startup with a big mission! We're looking for a dynamic Social Media Manager to join our journey, helping new parents escape loneliness - especially on those long days spent as sole carer. We help parents connect in their communities by finding baby & toddler groups in their local area. This is a great time to join us as we expand across the UK!

We are a small team who are passionate about the work we do to end loneliness in new parents and we are proud of our achievements with our products. We have seen huge growth in the last year and currently have over 1m website users a year, approaching 100k parents subscribers to our mailing list, and over 26k active classes.

We work remotely and flexibly and this important new role will help us take Happity's marketing to the next level, bringing Happity to a wider national audience.¬†¬†

If you have proven experience growing social media followings, are creative, innovative, detail driven and experienced in reporting then we want to hear from you!¬†

¬†

ABOUT YOU:

As you'll be working in a remote team, you'll need to be very self-motivated, able to manage your own time and an exceptional communicator! You'll also need to be available some weekends and evenings for engagement on posts.

You're someone who loves what Happity is about, you share our mission and want to make a positive difference in the world. You have a passion for helping us to grow as a brand.

You'll already have experience of growing a social media audience under your belt - whether that's been in a work capacity or other environment (such as voluntary or personal projects).

You don't need to be a parent to apply for this role, but you do need to demonstrate a sound knowledge of the market for baby & toddler classes - and in particular, what kind of content would appeal to an audience of new parents!

¬†

WHAT THE ROLE INVOLVES:

You will manage our social media presence, be responsible for generating content for social media, website, brand assets, advertising and more so that we can improve our brand awareness, customer responsiveness and ultimately make an even greater impact with our product.

The main responsibilities of this role include:¬†

  • Creating a social media content strategy to fit within our marketing strategy
  • Creating, scheduling and engaging on posts and stories (currently on Instagram and¬†Facebook)
  • Managing our Facebook Group to build community
  • Reporting on progress and improving strategy
  • Supporting or managing campaigns

It may also include:

  • Blog, Website and Advertising creation
  • Assisting with PR and other marketing tasks including engaging with influencers

¬†

WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR

What we're hoping to see highlighted on your CV and application:

Essential:

  • Social Media Strategy & Management - to be able to deliver on Happity's commercial and impact-driven goals. You'll be responsible for managing our online community of providers and parents, analysing and reporting social media activity (this should be using software such as Later or Buffer.) Reporting is across all channels - on acquisition, engagement, top-performing content etc. You would attend and contribute to monthly marketing meetings to shape the marketing strategy for the brand, discuss and review upcoming content, and review marketing campaigns.
  • Design - you will also have some experience with design software such as Canva, have an eye for design and fantastic attention to detail, being comfortable to edit, repurpose and create imagery, graphics and video / animations for use across our channels
  • Startup mentality: While we're an established, scaling organisation, we work very much like a lean, agile startup. You need to be great at prioritising (and knowing which corners to cut) - and working closely with a tight-knit, small team.
  • Passion for social media: You need to have in-depth knowledge of social media channels and a proven track record of creating and sustaining online communities.¬†
  • Creativity: We are looking for a person with loads of creativity and new ideas to improve our content, whether written, image or video. You will have fantastic copy-writing skills across both short-form (social media posts, ad copy etc) and long-form content (blogs, articles, press releases) and lots of good ideas! We are looking for someone with excellent written and verbal English language skills for the position.¬†
  • Analytical, customer-driven mindset: You're able to use your analytical brain to spot trends and identify opportunities for future activity. Alongside this you will be involved in analysing the SEO performance of our website content, identifying relevant keywords and ensuring our content targets those effectively.
  • Ability to learn new tools: You must be able to learn how to use new marketing tools with ease. Experience with HTML and website Content Management Systems as well as experience using email service providers (we use Active Campaign and Mailerlite currently) and CRM systems is a strong plus, but not a requirement for the job.
  • Purpose driven: We're making real social impact. We truly believe in what we're doing and want you to be part of that.¬†

Desirable:

  • You have experience managing paid advertising (Facebook, Google etc.)
  • You have good knowledge of site analytics tools (Google Analytics)
  • You have experience in PR and Partnerships
  • You have experience growing early-stage companies to post Series A in the consumer space
  • You have experience in a parenting company or digital solutions

¬†

All applicants should mention the word "Firework" to show they've read the requirements ;-)

¬†

Benefits and reasons why the role might appeal:

  • Work closely with the Founders of a purpose-led, exciting and fast-growing parentings brand
  • Join a friendly and fun marketing team made up of a mix of freelancers and part-time employees
  • Opportunity to provide key strategic input to key marketing and business strategies
  • Opportunity to work remotely and flexible, with unlimited holiday
  • Growth opportunity: as Happity grows there will be opportunity for the role to further expand¬†

¬†

HOW TO APPLY

If you are looking for a challenging and rewarding career in a socially-motivated, and growing business then please apply today by submitting your CV along with a cover letter¬†outlining:

  • Why Happity?
  • Why this role?
  • Why you?
  • Example of relevant previous work

¬†

HOURS & COMPENSATION

Hours: 15-18 hours per week initially with potential to grow if suitable

Pay: ¬£15-18 per hour depending on experience

Closing Date: 31st Jan 2023 with rolling interviews so the position may be filled sooner.

Happity is an equal opportunity employer and all applicants will be considered for employment regardless of ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or disability status.

As a Team Lead Data Insights you support Business Operations with the needed data for regular monitoring and reporting as well generating insights, models and other instruments to support the management in business optimization and profitability increase.¬†

We are looking for a team lead that is passionate about data and the possibilities that the right usage of data can bring in combination with business strategy and business questions.

As a Team Lead Data Insights you will gain a firm foundation on the data base together with the other data teams at Trusted Shops, provide vision, approach and planned execution. Therefore you carry the ownership of data projects and bigger business analysis projects, you take and understand the business requirements, implement and execute them with your team and present them to the stakeholder in a target oriented way.

independent of gender, nationality, ethnic and social origin, religion/belief, disability, age,¬†sexual orientation and identity. Trusted Shops is clearly committed to diversity and¬†against discrimination.

results.title: Content Writer
results.description:
Description

¬†

Are you an advanced WordPress user, very familiar with plugins, themes and hostings? Do you love writing engaging content? Are you able to set up a test website, optimize, analyze and then explain these technical topics in simple words?

If you answered yes to these questions, we are sure this position will sound super exciting to you. ü§©

We are looking for a friendly person, who loves to write, to produce high-quality technical content for¬†WP Rocket,¬†Imagify, and¬†RocketCDN. üöÄ

Keep reading for more details! üìù

¬†

Become Our Content Writer!

In your job as a¬†Content Writer,¬†you will write and manage content that builds credibility and authority for the company.¬†

In this role, you will report directly to the Content Marketing Manager. You will join our marketing team, which is based in Europe. We work remotely, and ideally you should live in a country that aligns with the¬†European Timezone.

We are so curious to know which new country will be added to our distributed team map! üåç

What You Will Be Doing:

In your everyday job as a Content Writer, you will be dealing with technical products. You are a skilled wordsmith who has proven software development experience. You will conduct research, set website environments, perform speed tests, write new content and update existing ones.¬†

Here is a list describing the missions involved in this position (do you happen to like making lists? So do we!):

  • Build Expertise:¬†You will conduct research on industry-related topics and need to stay up-to-date with the latest trends (the Core Web Vitals have no secret for you!). You will also make edits to existing content in an effort to improve readability, SEO, accuracy, and keep the content up-to-date overall.
  • Drive Traffic:¬†You will identify target keywords on a specific topic and structure your content accordingly
  • Develop Branding:¬†You will identify a unique angle to address the topic, that will show a different perspective or view, which will make the article especially interesting
  • Increase engagement:¬†You will write engaging, easy-to understand and accurate content (such as: blog posts, release announcements,‚Ä¶) You will use a conversational tone to make our products accessibles and to engage our audience.

¬†

What Do You Need To Excel at This Job:

Proven working experience in writing and editing.

You have a solid experience in creating well-structured content, in a conversational tone to guide beginners and more advanced WordPress users. You understand the importance of SEO and how to address it through your content writing.

Tech-savvy with well-honed web performance knowledge.

You have experience with web performance optimization. You know how to measure page load speeds. You understand caching. Terms like gzip, preload, minify, and lazyload are not foreign to you. You know the difference between PageSpeed score and page load time.

Advanced knowledge and understanding of WordPress.

You have a working knowledge of WordPress: you can set up a local website to test out products and services. You are familiar with the various types of plugins, themes and hostings. You have written a few articles about WordPress.

Fluency in English.

You will need to be able to effectively write and communicate in English, respectfully, and professionally. You can proofread your work.¬†

Do you want to know three other things we appreciate about our candidates?

  • A startup mentality¬†
    You are doer, you are adaptable and you like to evolve in a fast-paced environment.
  • Previous remote job experience.
    Slack will be your virtual office, where all the life of the company takes place.
  • The involvement in the WordPress community.
    We support our teammates to attend and/or speak at WordCamps and volunteer within the community.

results.title: Head of Product Marketing
results.description:
Company Description

Our mission is to transform the way online learning experiences are created, managed, and delivered on a global scale. Our goal is to become the premier enterprise platform for organizations who need to train and engage with their customers. We are a fast-growing tech company --¬† a people-first organization with a flexible, fun, hard-working environment.



Job Description

As Thought Industries Head of Product Marketing, you will work with sales / marketing, product, and customer experience peers to build new pipeline, improve sales performance, increase prospect and customer engagement, and accelerate overall product adoption. You will also be responsible for developing differentiated GTM processes and strategies for all Ti products across the company‚Äôs core markets in external enterprise learning and professional training, and the core verticals of Business Services, Manufacturing and Software.¬† This includes driving the creation of differentiated competitive positioning, messaging, pricing and packaging, and sales enablement tools for all customer-facing teams.¬†

This position mashes up creative, sales, and analytical skills, and requires an agile thinker who can blend customer intelligence, storytelling, data manipulation, and technology to translate the value of our product to new and existing customers.¬†

In this role, you‚Äôll be successful if you can:

  • Own the Go-to-Market strategy for all products and corresponding market segments and use cases; work with marketing, sales, customer experience, and product peers to identify and exceed business goals on a consistent basis.

  • Market Strategy:¬†

    • Conduct market and customer research to gather data and insights about target personas, buyer needs, competitive differentiators, and the purchasing decision process, including creating key buyer roles.

  • GTM Messaging & Positioning:¬†

    • Develop consistent messaging and positioning and ensure marketing and customer-facing teams are aligned on the latest market trends.

    • Become the expert in the competitive landscape, and ensure battlecards, product collateral, and other field enablement materials reflect current market conditions.

  • Product GTM

    • Own our strategic product GTM efforts. Ensure competitive differentiators and value-based messaging is created and communicated across marketing, sales, and customer experience teams.¬†

    • Influence the product roadmap with well-defined market requirements.

  • Field Enablement

    • Work with Field Sales, Sales Operations and Sales Enablement teams to develop enablement and training materials and programs that resonate with the buying audience and communicate the value of the Thought Industries solution.

  • Assist Customer Marketing in the creation of customer references and¬† testimonials for external and internal use.

  • Thought Leadership:¬†

    • Collaborate with the Content Strategy team to create industry leading thought leadership content and event programming.¬†

    • Articulate the value of the Thought Industries platform via quantitative customer case studies, product videos, and website copy, as needed

    • Provide expert guidance, when requested, for marketing emails, content marketing, and customer communications.

  • Other Responsibilities:

    • Provide input into value-based messaging, and assist the Sales team in improving RFP success rates.

    • Assist the Product team in launching and communicating product updates and improvements.¬†

    ¬†



Qualifications

Sound like something you‚Äôd love to do? Fantastic! Your background and experience should include, but is not necessarily limited to the following:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in marketing, business, or related field desired.

  • 7-9+ years of experience working in a B2B SaaS-focused product marketing role.¬†

  • Experience owning and strategic GTM planning and execution in a fast-growing tech environment¬†

  • Experience working with a direct sales team, as well as with product management and customer success teams.

  • Deep understanding of software, manufacturing, or telecom industries¬†

  • Self-starter eager to own projects and take the initiative where there‚Äôs room for improvement

  • Demonstrated ability to communicate the value of a product to solving business challenges. We want to communicate ‚Äúwhy‚Äù more than ‚Äúwhat.‚Äù

  • Strong left brain / right brain execution that combines creativity with analytical rigor.¬†

  • Excellent written and in-person communication skills. Our team works 100% remotely and it's important that we're able to understand each other through text and spoken word.¬†

  • Eagerness to collaborate, learn, and contribute. You‚Äôre equally comfortable writing content for a sales sheet and landing page as you are defining and managing the various components of a product launch.

  • Previous experience with Customer Education and/or online learning software is preferred¬†

  • Comfortable working closely with leadership teams at a cross-departmental level

  • Passionate, motivated and hungry to succeed



Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

¬†

Thought Industries does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law. Employment decisions at Thought Industries are based on merit, qualifications, and abilities.

results.title: Product Marketing Manager
results.description:
About Mangomint

Mangomint is a fast-growing Series A stage SaaS company on a mission to provide next-generation software that embeds so seamlessly into the day-to-day activities of salons and spas, that it effectively disappears. Our platform is used (and loved!) daily by more than 10,000 salon and spa professionals in the U.S. and Canada to handle everything from appointment booking, staff management, payment processing, and so much more.

Backed by one of the leading product-led growth VCs, you can be sure the opportunity to work at Mangomint is filled with possibilities.

We‚Äôre still a pretty small team but we‚Äôre doing really BIG things. We‚Äôre a fully remote, fun and hard-working team with the occasional in-person meetup every few months. Come build with us!


About the Role

Our ideal Product Marketing Manager is a growth-minded, customer journey obsessed self-starter who has deep experience collaborating with product, marketing, sales and customer success teams to develop GTM strategy, perfect product positioning and drive customer acquisition, adoption and expansion.

As our first dedicated product marketing hire, this role will lead the charge in driving core product marketing functions ‚Äî think product launches, value-based messaging, market and competitor research, ICP and persona development, sales enablement, etc. ‚Äî and also work closely with product and engineering to identify, test and implement in-product growth levers.

This role sits at the intersection of product, product marketing and growth in a strong PLG-focused organization and is the perfect opportunity for a nimble and analytical rising growth leader.

What you‚Äôll be doing

  • Own core product marketing functions including product launches, value-based messaging, market and competitor research, ICP and persona development, sales enablement, etc.
  • Lead the growth charge; strategize and execute on growth experiments and in-product loops that drive signups, usage, and retention
  • Measure the effectiveness of product marketing and growth efforts; connect impact to key business metrics
  • Analyze data to pinpoint high impact opportunities and manage prioritization of future experiments and initiatives
  • Build messaging and positioning for Mangomint products that clearly communicates our competitive advantage in the market
  • Intimately understand our market, customers and competitive landscape; you are the voice of the customer
  • Optimize the full customer journey to maximize user experience and adoption (especially the free trial process)
  • Work collaboratively with product, marketing, sales, customer success and other internal teams
  • Influence strategy for and manage growth-oriented product roadmap initiatives
  • Help build cross-functional product management and product marketing processes at scale

Requirements

  • 2+ years of hands-on product marketing and/or growth marketing experience in B2B SaaS
  • Deep knowledge of product-led growth strategy and tactics; ability to look at all opportunities, experiments and initiatives through a PLG lens
  • Data obsessed with analytical mindset; organized in planning, executing and tracking performance
  • Strong testing mentality and ability to be analytical in everything you do
  • Extensive experience with product marketing functions like product launches, enablement, market research, ICP development, etc.
  • Exceptional ability to write product messaging that communicates value and connects to the market‚Äôs needs
  • Deep customer empathy and ability to impact experience across full customer journey
  • Proficiency with marketing and analytics tools (Segment, Mixpanel, Intercom, marketing automation, in-app messaging, CRM, etc.)
  • Strong project management skills, including ability prioritize high impact activities and move complex project forward efficiently and effectively
  • Extensive knowledge of SaaS product management processes; has the technical chops to collaborate with engineers
  • Curious, continuous learner who thrives in startup environment

Benefits

  • Unlimited PTO
  • Generous monthly wellness budget for gym memberships, yoga, spas, etc.
  • Premium subscription to the Calm app
  • Health, dental and vision insurance
  • Lots of opportunities for career and personal growth
  • Remote work
  • Competitive compensation
  • Supportive environment with fun and respectful culture
  • 401k (no matching‚Ä¶yet)



Mangomint is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity), national origin, age, disability and genetic information (including family medical history).

results.description:
About the Opportunity
Settle is on a mission to change the way that businesses pay other businesses. Since the company‚Äôs inception in 2019, we‚Äôve been building a cashflow management platform that allows founders and small business owners to more easily manage their company‚Äôs financial health with a mix of accounts payable and flexible financing tools. We already work with some amazing brands that you probably know and love, like Starface, Ghia, and Italic.

We‚Äôre growing quickly and looking to expand our small-but-mighty marketing team from two to three. This role will offer an exciting hands-on opportunity for a builder to lay the foundation for, and fuel our growth with digital campaigns of all types, from email to PPC and more. You‚Äôll help deploy cross-channel campaigns in conjunction with our sales team to maximize lead generation, upsells, and ultimately conversions. As the third member of the marketing team, you‚Äôll have a unique chance to drive the long-term direction of the org and plenty of opportunity for personal career growth as well.

How You‚Äôll Make an Impact
- Strategize, conceptualize, and execute campaigns across digital channels
- Develop marketing hypotheses and test assumptions with quantitative analysis
- Drive measurable impact to the business through growing pipeline
- Collaborate with Product Marketing and Customer Success to automate and optimize marketing flows
- Partner closely with Sales to develop alignment needed to set the business up to hit growth targets
- Optimize targeted campaigns to drive results within distinct customer segments
- Source and manage external contractors and agencies to augment marketing efforts when needed
- Source, optimize, and implement appropriate marketing tools to deliver positive ROI to the business

What Sets You Apart
- 5+ years experience in a B2B marketing role
- Previous experience working closely with a sales org to define handoff criteria and set them up for success converting leads
- Previous experience building and executing email marketing (and drip) campaigns
- Broad experience with top of funnel ‚Äî¬†you‚Äôre comfortable with a variety of digital mediums, from email to SEO to paid search/social and beyond. You don‚Äôt need to be an expert in everything but you will have at least dabbled across channels
- Experience building and running paid digital ads on platforms like Google and LinkedIn.
- Fluent in Google Analytics (or other analytics platforms) and marketing attribution
- Prior experience with building out at least one marketing system in a previous role, and opinions about tooling/marketing stack
- Desire and ability to take calculated risks
- Strong written and verbal communication skills
- Great at identifying gaps and asking questions to find a solution (rather than waiting for a solution to fall into your lap)
Bonuses:
- A personal interest in DTC/CPG/Ecomm industry or fintech, or both
- Experience managing social media accounts for a brand/business
- Experience building budgets for omnichannel campaigns
- Comfortable with Salesforce
- Previous experience managing a team as well as agencies and/or freelancers

Compensation
This role has an annual starting salary range of $125,000 - $140,000 + equity + benefits.¬†Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to your individual skills and experience.

Who We Are
Settle is a FinTech company on a mission to help businesses thrive by taking the worry out of cash flow management. We‚Äôre building software making it super easy for finance teams to track, pay, and reconcile invoices. We pair that with lending products to offer our customers the power and flexibility to choose who, when, and how to pay their customers.

Our small but growing team was founded in San Francisco along with an engineering hub in Lviv, Ukraine. We‚Äôre building a fully distributed team and support you working from wherever you are. We're well funded (Series-B) with backing by Ribbit, Stripes, Kleiner Perkins, Founder‚Äôs Fund, SciFi Ventures, and others. Our benefits are competitive, our time off is flexible, and our compensation packages include equity.

Check out this Techcrunch article and Kleiner blog post.

Our Commitment to You
At Settle we know that cultivating diversity and fostering an inclusive work environment is critical to our impact and success. We create an environment where no individual is advantaged or disadvantaged because of their background. We offer equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, or protected veteran status.

With a commitment to maintaining a bias-free environment in which harassment is prohibited, we respect cultural diversity and comply with the laws of the places in which we operate. We expect our business partners, suppliers, clients, and all of our team members to uphold these commitments.

results.title: Performance Marketing Manager
results.description:
About In Good Taste:

Since we launched our eCommerce site two years ago, we have sold 2 million bottles and hosted thousands of private and corporate tasting events.

About the Performance Marketing Manager:

The Performance Marketing Manager will report directly to the CRO to lead strategy, execution, analysis and optimization of IGT's marketing and communication channels. You will be responsible for the top of the marketing funnel to drive awareness and visitors to our website. You will be responsible for deploying ad dollars and maximizing profitable returns.

Role and responsibilities:

  • Create, manage, analyze, and adjust our digital marketing strategy
  • Lead development of audience retention strategy, journeys and tactics
